newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha steady to weak but quiet.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha steady to weak but quiet.

text.p: NWE naphtha was slightly weaker on Monday in response to a slight easing on the Brent crude futures markets late on Friday, traders said.
July swaps were talked flat to August and September at $180/$181 a tonne cif NWE.
"It is so incredibly quiet," one refinery-based trader said.

Petrobras was seen having fixed a 70,000 tonne cargo from Yanbu to Brazil and dealers said they thought the company was likely to take spot volumes from Skikda too, over and above existing contractual volumes.
Dealers said that while petrochemical demand was relatively good, reformers were unlikely to seek naphtha considering the weakness on the gasoline barge markets.
